channel.title: Where do I put commands?
channel.description:
Where do I put commands??
I have some and I don't know where I put them..
Please help.

item.title: Where do I put commands?
item.dc:creator: @roxindude36 roxindude36
item.description:
@roxindude36 wrote:

I was gonna use fram testing but then i thought different cause of my glowing stuff =\

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I put commands?
item.dc:creator: @craids craids
item.description:
@craids wrote:

[quote=“roxindude36, post:2, topic:52648”]Open client.java and search for

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("barrows")

Under the last “}” put something like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("whip") && playerRights >= 0) addItem(4151,1); }

Doesnt have to be a whip but you do have to know the item code i can give you an example like of full drag

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("dragon") && playerRights >= 0) { addItem(1149, 1); addItem(1187, 1); addItem(3140, 1); addItem(4087, 1); addItem(4585, 1); addItem(5698, 1); addItem(5716, 100); sendMessage("DRAGON 4LYFE!"); } Something like this but it has to be under the “}” or you will get errors, then you need to compile and there you go.

Does this help?[/quote]
He just needs to know where to put them, not all sources have that command by the way.
Search for
“end of frame testing”
Under that is what your looking for

Read full topic

item.title: Where do I put commands?
item.dc:creator: @roxindude36 roxindude36
item.description:
@roxindude36 wrote:

Open client.java and search for

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("barrows")

Under the last “}” put something like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("whip") && playerRights >= 0) addItem(4151,1); }

Doesnt have to be a whip but you do have to know the item code i can give you an example like of full drag

else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("dragon") && playerRights >= 0) { addItem(1149, 1); addItem(1187, 1); addItem(3140, 1); addItem(4087, 1); addItem(4585, 1); addItem(5698, 1); addItem(5716, 100); sendMessage("DRAGON 4LYFE!"); } Something like this but it has to be under the “}” or you will get errors, then you need to compile and there you go.

Does this help?

Read full topic
